meanings.definition: A person or thing that saves time.
meanings.sent1: Using a timesaver like a dishwasher can help you finish chores faster.
meanings.sent2: The new app on my phone is a real timesaver when it comes to organizing my schedule.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock became my timesaver when I kept hitting snooze every morning.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking was a timesaver in the emergency situation.
meanings.sent5: The invention of the wheel was a revolutionary timesaver for transportation.

meanings.definition: A tool or method that reduces the amount of time needed to complete a task.
meanings.sent1: The food processor is a handy timesaver in the kitchen for chopping vegetables quickly.
meanings.sent2: The shortcut through the park proved to be a timesaver on my daily commute.
meanings.sent3: The automatic car wash was a timesaver for busy drivers who didn't have time to wash their cars themselves.
meanings.sent4: The new software program is a digital timesaver for streamlining data entry processes.
meanings.sent5: The invention of the printing press was a monumental timesaver for producing books.
